definition: to be nothing to write home about (idiom)
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

sentences.english: As for finding businesses, however, we found the usefulness of the feature to be limited.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这项新功能在寻找企业方面则乏善可陈。

sentences.english: Their sex-life will never be dull.
sentences.chinese: 他们的性生活也从不会乏善可陈。

sentences.english: There wasn't much in the game and Galati were unlucky not to get a draw.
sentences.chinese: 比赛本身乏善可陈，他们没能拿到1场平均有点可惜。

sentences.english: Mumbai and São Paulo are too much of a muchness.
sentences.chinese: 孟买和圣保罗大同小异，乏善可陈。

sentences.english: Another thought the white woman was very cliched.
sentences.chinese: 另一个觉得白种女人乏善可陈。

definition: ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
conforming with the norms of society
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
not in the least/to completely lack
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
